title: How Start-Ups Tackle Omni-Channel Disruption
text:
Magazine Article | October 21, 2015 How Start-Ups Tackle Omni-Channel Disruption To access this content, please Register or Sign In. 
November 2015 Innovative Retail Technologies 
By Michael Olmstead, partner, director, Plug And Play Retail 
Here’s how five retail tech start-ups merge digital and physical retail for true omni-channel disruption. 
Retailers continue to struggle to compete with e-commerce-only competitors, such as Amazon, Wayfair, and Jet on selection, price, and convenience. When the retailer does win the customer, they still have difficulties understanding the omni-channel journey that has occurred, as the vast majority of considered purchases start online. With online sales accounting for nearly 10 percent of total retail sales, it is obvious that retail as a whole is experiencing a digital transformation. This presents a huge opportunity for brick-and-mortar to invest in digital technologies that can enhance the in-store experience by mimicking the best part of e-commerce — convenience. Unfortunately, it is a bit of a process for a retailer to source, vet, qualify, and eventually pilot start-ups. This is where Plug and Play Retail comes in.
